titleproper.value: Guide to the Bronx Teen Resource and Referral Network Records <num>TAM 581</num>

publisher.value: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

creation.value: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace <date>2018-06-22T15:05:03</date>

corpname.value: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

unittitle.value: Bronx Teen Resource and Referral Network Records

abstract.value: The Bronx Teen Resource and Referral Network, formerly the Bronx Teen Pregnancy Network, was established in 1983. The Network functioned as a self-selected coalition of organizations, institutions, individuals. This collection includes materials related to the Network's activities and programs that provided education, support, and guidance to teenagers in the Bronx, particularly on the topics of pregnancy and sexually-transmitted diseases. There is also a substantial amount of material pertaining to fundraising.

p.value: Identification of item, date; Bronx Teen Resource and Referral Network Records; TAM 581; box number; folder number; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.
Donated by Yvonne M. H. Cook on behalf of the Bronx Teen Resource and Referral Network in 1996. The accession number associated with this collection is 2011.062.
The Bronx Teen Resource and Referral Network closed in January 1996 because of lack of funding.

This collection consists of the records of the Bronx Teen Resource and Referral Network from its founding in 1983 to its closure in 1996.  The largest portion of the collection relates to the organization's unceasing search for funds (contracts, grants, proposals, and related material).  However, there is also significant coverage of the Network's activities and programs that provided education, support, and guidance to teenagers in the Bronx, particularly on the topics of pregnancy and sexually-transmitted diseases.  The files of executive director Agnes Cooper Dennis are especially well-represented, as is the Better Bronx for Youth program.
